body:
Dumbass thoughts 💭 (Just scroll past this)

I just had a thought about the infamous Steve Rogers. I don’t know if it’s me not paying attention, but I don’t really see Steve without the whole Captain America thing, I mean struggles and personality wise. Of course we see a dude who loves his country and will fight for it, then the best friend Bucky and whatnot. I sound dumb as hell 💀😭 But, what I mean is I don’t really see Steve Rogers as much as I see “Captain America”. I find it hard to separate Steve from the shield like I separate Peter P. from “Spiderman”

blog.name: marvelmakesmefeel

summary: This might be nothing, but I needed to share this scary theory I had. Notice how everybody is staring left? Well, everybody...
body:
This might be nothing, but I needed to share this scary theory I had. Notice how everybody is staring left? Well, everybody accept two people: Thor and Okoye. They’re both looking right.

In cinema, the direction a character is looking is very important rhetorically. A character looking to the right of the screen is looking forward to the future and the accomplishment of their goal. A character looking to the left is reflecting on their past.

Now hear me out: What if Thor and Okoye are the only people looking to the future because they’re the only ones who live to see it? The obvious deaths, like Tony and Cap, are looking left, in the past, where they’ll soon be. Thor, who needs to figure out the future of the Asgardian people after Thanos’ attack, and Okoye, are looking to the future. Does this mean Okoye has a future as the next Black Panther?

Just a theory, but one that I thought was worth sharing.

summary: Predictions : Disney, Fox and the Marvel Cinematic Universe
title: Predictions : Disney, Fox and the Marvel Cinematic Universe
body:
After months and months of speculation as to whether or not it would happen, Disney and Fox finally came to terms on an acquisition, effective as of March 20, 2019.  In the stated terms of the merger, Disney became owner of all Fox film studio properties, along with their TV and news branches.  For film fans, this means that Marvel Studios, at long last, finally has creative control of the characters and intellectual property they created that was once controlled by Fox.  This includes, but is not limited to, the X-Men, Deadpool, Spider-Man and the Fantastic Four, among other supporting characters and villains involved.

This also means that a possible entirely new world of stories may now be told, some of which fans have either been clamoring for, or have no idea that they want.  Here are a handful of classic Marvel tales that I wouldn’t mind seeing transferred into the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Avengers : Endgame will mark the first major event in the MCU where the fate of heroes is thrown into question.  For my money’s worth, once the next phase/generation of stories begins, the inclusion of the X-Men in the MCU begs for House of M to be the next event that puts the fate of superheroes at jeopardy while simultaneously questioning the morals and the ethics of the existence of superheroes and mutants.  The story centers around Scarlet Witch, who is slowly descending into madness under the care of her father, Magneto, and her brother, Quicksilver.  Magneto confides in his longtime friend Professor X about the situation, as the combination of Scarlet Witch’s immense powers and the scope of her insanity threatens to exceed the level of Professor X’s ability to contain her.  As the teams of heroes meet with individual heroes to determine the fate of Scarlet Witch, Magneto and Quicksilver decide to take matters into their own hands, pitting friends against one another for the sake of family, and ultimately putting the existence of all super-powered and mutant heroes and villains on Scarlet Witch’s radar into question.

It has been firmly established that the Hulk is by far one of the most powerful beings in the MCU, having only been bested on-screen (so far) by Thor and Thanos.  One thing that the MCU has yet to do, however, is establish Hulk as a character that can hold his own for a solo film.  What better opportunity to examine the struggle that is Bruce Banner versus the Hulk than by having him lose control and damage a town, only to have to helicopter in Wolverine to possibly subdue him?  That would provide plenty of ground to examine the Hulk character, it’d be a dynamite way to introduce Wolverine and the X-Men into the MCU, and who wouldn’t be down for a movie that would essentially be 80-85% hand to hand combat between two warriors that are fueled by pain, rage, and have the ability to heal themselves?

With Marvel planting its feet firmly in the cosmic realm moving forward, it only makes sense that the recent acquisition of the Fantastic Four should lead to more galactic characters, including the wildly popular Silver Surfer and the immense threat that is Galactus.  Instances of the Celestial threat have already been teased, as have the inclusion of Watchers and Cosmic Beings, but those familiar with Galactus know the level of threat that he could potentially pose for a wide range of heroes, Earth-bound or otherwise.

While Black Panther already holds the honor of having been nominated for Best Picture during the 2019 Academy Awards, the MCU lacks a story compelling enough, but accessible enough, to play as Oscar-bait… that is, unless, the right director gets their hands on Marvels, a tale about the impact that a world full of superheores and mutants has on normal people.  First and foremost, this is an opportunity to interject recognizable actors into the MCU without the burden of having to hide them behind a costume, a mask or CGI.  Secondly, this would allow those actors and actresses to bring their dramatic chops and the ability to make stories connect with audiences in parallel with their interactions with and among the MCU’s established heroes, thus bringing the hero credibility to another level.  Thirdly, and most importantly, it is a real chance to the MCU to connect to an audience outside of their key demographic, perhaps even expanding the demographic greatly.

There may already be a Black Panther sequel in the works, but in my opinion, the first film sowed seeds for what could be an amazing story about Wakanda and their role in the bigger world, which would be the perfect counterpoint to the first film.  Bucky, the lore of the ‘White Wolf’, and the Hatut Zeraze, better known as the War Dogs, were all introduced in the first film, and the film ended with Wakanda stepping out of the shadows and into the role as a world leader.  All of the dominoes are set up and ready to be tipped for the Hatut Zeraze to decide that they have a different agenda, rise up as an opposing force to Wakanda and their worldly allies, and put King T’Challa firmly into the spot of having to question Wakanda’s role in and obligations to the world yet again.  The Bucky connection almost certainly means that Captain America and a team of Avengers will be involved in the conflict, so what’s not to love about this idea?

With a very large queue of upcoming MCU movies already in the works, these ideas may not see the light of day for a long time, if ever.  There are plenty more wonderful ideas as well, some of which I may address in the near future, but regardless of what happens, Marvel pretty much has my money, guaranteed.

blog.name: blissful-yeetings
blog.title: Just Y E E T Me Into The Pitﾟ*｡

tags: keep lana condor as Jubilee and let he be the main charcater
summary: The only thing I’m actually hoping for with the Disney/Fox merger and Disney having the rights to X-Men characters is a Freeform...
body:
The only thing I’m actually hoping for with the Disney/Fox merger and Disney having the rights to X-Men characters is a Freeform or Hulu tv series actually focusing on the STUDENTS of Xavier’s school.

Seriously Marvel, give me dumb mutant school antics featuring the characters that never got a chance to shine in the X-men movies.

I don’t even care if it’s a generic highschool drama. Or heck, go all out and make it a comedy series, like “Ned’s Declassified School Survivors Guide”, with Lana Condor as Jubilee showing the new students how to survive in a school lile Xavier’s.

The possibilities are endless and I swear, if we have to sit through the same Wolvine/Professor X/Magneto stories, I will die

reblog.comment:
The only thing I’m actually hoping for with the Disney/Fox merger and Disney having the rights to X-Men characters is a Freeform or Hulu tv series actually focusing on the STUDENTS of Xavier’s school.

Seriously Marvel, give me dumb mutant school antics featuring the characters that never got a chance to shine in the X-men movies.

I don’t even care if it’s a generic highschool drama. Or heck, go all out and make it a comedy series, like “Ned’s Declassified School Survivors Guide”, with Lana Condor as Jubilee showing the new students how to survive in a school lile Xavier’s.

The possibilities are endless and I swear, if we have to sit through the same Wolvine/Professor X/Magneto stories, I will die

title: Candied Romance
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2U1cZGD

by anselem

Steve meets his dream Alpha in a coffee shop.

Bucky meets his dream Omega in a coffee shop.

Their paths are so wildly different but life is a highway and they’re both going 70.

[for me and a little shithead. he knows who he is. yeah, you, motherfucker.]

summary: Seven times Steve Rogers was not what everyone expected him to be (+1 time he really, really wasn't what everyone expected him...
title: Seven times Steve Rogers was not what everyone expected him to be (+1 time he really, really wasn't what everyone expected him to be)
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TDpYcn

by StuckySituation

Steve Rogers’s patriotic eyebrows jump up. “Holy cow.”

That was not what Tony would have expected from Captain America. “‘Holy cow’? Did the history books mess up? Was your family actually from India and not Ireland?”

“Fuck off, Stark. I ain’t shitting on what comes out of your mouth, so you better leave my goddamn cows alone as well.”

Tony doesn’t know whether to feel awestruck or betrayed. “You,” he says and points at Rogers, “are nothing like I expected.”

“Sorry to be a fucking disappointment,” Rogers says with a scowl and pulls his ridiculous helmet on, covering the sleekly styled brown hair. It was astonishing how even Rogers’s golden hair had been false propaganda – but of course the great America had wanted to present its figurehead as Aryan perfection in the time of eugenics. “Suit up, everyone. Let’s get this shit done.”

Words: 2298, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Captain America (Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/M, M/M
  • Characters: James “Bucky” Barnes, Steve Rogers, Natasha Romanov (Marvel), Sam Wilson (Marvel), Tony Stark, Clint Barton
  • Relationships: James “Bucky” Barnes/Steve Rogers, Minor or Background Relationship(s)
  • Additional Tags: Humor, Alternate Universe - Canon Divergence, 5+1 Things, Except this is 7+1 but whatevers


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2TDpYcn
